question: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has signed a licensing agreement with which global operator of exchanges and clearing houses?
explanation:
Asia\'s oldest stock exchange, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has signed a licensing agreement with Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) Futures Europe, a global operator of exchanges and clearing houses.
The agreement was signed to use its Brent index as the settlement benchmark for the stock marketâ€™s rupee-denominated Brent futures contracts. This licensing agreement will give access for rupee-denominated Brent benchmark prices, to Indian market participants. It will also enable the price of Brent crude prices to be discovered in the Indian time zone.
